alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 27 at 9:04AM AKST until February 28 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Locally higher amounts over Nunivak Island. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph in combination with snow will reduce visibilities to one quarter mile near the coast and over Nunivak Island. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and create snow drifts. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
